data.event: The town was first chartered in 1735 by Governor Jonathan Belcher of Massachusetts.

Granted to soldiers returning from the war in Canada, it was named Sylvester-Canada in honor of Captain Joseph Sylvester of Scituate, Massachusetts, who was killed in 1690 during an attempt to capture Quebec.
It was incorporated in 1752 as Richmond by Governor Benning Wentworth.
It was settled about 1757 by emigrants from Rhode Island and Massachusetts.
